storyTitle: As Employee, I want to receive notifications about schedule changes to stay informed

testCases.title: Validate display of schedule change notifications on login
preconditions: Employee account exists and is active in the system
Employee has valid login credentials
At least one unread schedule change notification exists for the employee in ScheduleChangeNotifications table
Web portal is accessible and functional
Employee is not currently logged in

steps.action: Navigate to the web portal login page
steps.expectedResult: Login page is displayed with username and password fields

steps.action: Enter valid employee credentials and click login button
steps.expectedResult: Employee is successfully authenticated and redirected to the dashboard

steps.action: Observe the notification area on the dashboard upon login
steps.expectedResult: Notification banner or icon is displayed prominently indicating there are unread notifications

steps.action: Click on the notification banner or icon to view notification details
steps.expectedResult: Notification panel opens displaying the schedule change notification with complete details including date, time, shift information, and change description

steps.action: Review the notification details for accuracy
steps.expectedResult: All notification details are displayed correctly and match the schedule change information

steps.action: Click the 'Mark as Read' button or option on the notification
steps.expectedResult: Notification is marked as read, visual indicator changes (e.g., notification becomes grayed out or moves to read section)

steps.action: Refresh the page or navigate away and return to the notifications area
steps.expectedResult: The notification remains in the read state, confirming status persistence

steps.action: Log out from the web portal
steps.expectedResult: Employee is successfully logged out and redirected to login page

steps.action: Log back in with the same employee credentials
steps.expectedResult: Employee logs in successfully and the previously marked notification remains in read status, confirming persistence across sessions

postconditions: Notification status is updated to 'read' in the ScheduleChangeNotifications table
Notification no longer appears in the unread notifications list
Employee remains logged in or is logged out based on final action

testCases.title: Verify notifications are only shown to relevant employees
preconditions: Multiple employee accounts exist in the system
Schedule change notifications exist for specific employees in ScheduleChangeNotifications table
Test employee account has at least one notification assigned to them
Other employees have different notifications not related to the test employee
Web portal is accessible and functional
Employee is not currently logged in

steps.action: Identify and document the notifications assigned to the test employee in the database
steps.expectedResult: List of notification IDs and details specific to the test employee is documented

steps.action: Navigate to the web portal login page
steps.expectedResult: Login page is displayed successfully

steps.action: Enter the test employee's valid credentials and click login
steps.expectedResult: Test employee is successfully authenticated and redirected to the dashboard

steps.action: Access the notifications section by clicking on the notification banner or icon
steps.expectedResult: Notifications panel opens displaying a list of notifications

steps.action: Review all displayed notifications and compare them with the documented list from step 1
steps.expectedResult: Only notifications related to the test employee's schedule are displayed; no notifications belonging to other employees are shown

steps.action: Verify each notification contains information relevant to the logged-in employee (employee ID, name, or schedule details)
steps.expectedResult: All notifications contain the test employee's information and are relevant to their schedule changes

steps.action: Check that the notification count matches the expected number of notifications for this employee
steps.expectedResult: Notification count is accurate and matches the number of notifications assigned to the test employee in the database

postconditions: No unauthorized access to other employees' notifications occurred

storyTitle: As Employee, I want to dismiss notifications to manage my notification list effectively

testCases.title: Validate notification dismissal process
preconditions: Employee is logged into the web portal
At least one active notification exists for the employee
Notification is visible in the employee's notification list
POST /api/notifications/dismiss endpoint is functional
Employee has authenticated access to dismiss notifications

steps.action: Navigate to the notifications section on the dashboard
steps.expectedResult: Notifications panel is displayed with a list of active notifications

steps.action: Identify a notification to dismiss and note its details (ID, content)
steps.expectedResult: Target notification is clearly visible with dismiss option available

steps.action: Click the 'Dismiss' button or icon on the selected notification
steps.expectedResult: Confirmation dialog is displayed asking 'Are you sure you want to dismiss this notification?' with 'Confirm' and 'Cancel' options

steps.action: Review the confirmation dialog message
steps.expectedResult: Confirmation message is clear and provides context about the dismissal action

steps.action: Click the 'Confirm' button in the confirmation dialog
steps.expectedResult: Confirmation dialog closes and the notification is immediately removed from the active notification list

steps.action: Verify the notification is no longer visible in the notification list
steps.expectedResult: The dismissed notification is not present in the active notification list

steps.action: Check the backend database or use API to verify notification status
steps.expectedResult: Notification status in ScheduleChangeNotifications table is updated to 'dismissed' and the change is persisted

steps.action: Refresh the page to confirm the dismissal persists
steps.expectedResult: Dismissed notification remains removed from the list after page refresh

postconditions: Notification is removed from the active notification list
Notification status is updated to 'dismissed' in the backend database
Dismissal action is persisted across sessions

testCases.title: Verify dismissal action completes within performance SLA
preconditions: Employee is logged into the web portal
At least one active notification exists for the employee
Network connection is stable
Performance monitoring tool or browser developer tools are available to measure response time
POST /api/notifications/dismiss endpoint is functional

steps.action: Open browser developer tools and navigate to the Network tab
steps.expectedResult: Developer tools are open and Network tab is active for monitoring API calls

steps.action: Navigate to the notifications section on the dashboard
steps.expectedResult: Notifications panel is displayed with active notifications

steps.action: Start timing or prepare to monitor the network request timing
steps.expectedResult: Timer is ready or network monitoring is active

steps.action: Click the 'Dismiss' button on a notification
steps.expectedResult: Confirmation dialog is displayed

steps.action: Click 'Confirm' in the confirmation dialog and monitor the API call timing
steps.expectedResult: POST request to /api/notifications/dismiss is initiated and visible in Network tab

steps.action: Observe the time taken for the notification to be removed from the UI
steps.expectedResult: Notification is removed from the list and the entire dismissal action completes within 2 seconds

steps.action: Check the Network tab for the API response time of the dismiss endpoint
steps.expectedResult: API response time is recorded and is within 2 seconds, meeting the performance SLA

steps.action: Repeat the dismissal process for 2-3 additional notifications to ensure consistent performance
steps.expectedResult: All dismissal actions complete within 2 seconds consistently

postconditions: All tested notifications are dismissed successfully
Performance SLA of 2 seconds is met for all dismissal actions
Backend status is updated for all dismissed notifications
